content:
I've started looking at Data at the Point of Care and I've gotta say, it's just great. Really well done API - straightforward documentation and great execution on some bulk FHIR.

Has anyone else been using it? It looks like it's sandbox only, so trying to understand when it might go into production.
@Bill Harty tagging you, as it looks like you may be involved, now that I'm searching the Zulip a bit

Hi Brendan, sorry for my slow response, was off zulip for a few days. Currently we have just a few customers using the API. I think just one or two of them are using it in an actual production setting and the others are still in test/pilot. I'm happy to answer any specific questions (my role is basically FHIR oversight) and/or I can connect you with the DPC team if you want to have more in-depth conversations, get together in person, attend our office-hours, etc. Sounds like you've already checked out our sandbox/docs. There's also a Google Group if you're interested. https://groups.google.com/g/DPC-API
